Under terms of the deals being negotiated, Brookfield will buy either 100% of the company for as much as $4.35 a share, or Brookfield will buy 50.1% of its outstanding shares for as much as $4.25 each, and replace SunEdison Inc. as its sponsor.

Shares of TerraForm Global Inc. GLBL, +0.16% surged 2.5% in premarket trade Monday, after the renewable energy company announced an exclusivity deal to negotiate with Brookfield Asset Management regarding a potential buyout.
TerraForm's stock has gained 12% over the past 12 months, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% has gained 19%.
SunEdison suneq had filed for bankruptcy in April 2016.
The exclusivity agreement will expire at 11:59 p.m.
